name: Electrical Power
description: You will have to use electrically-powered equipment to build some of the components for your moon rocket. Well, they aren't technically powered electrically. They're powered by a system known as "Redstone Flux." Some other mods have their own systems, but they are all compatible with this. It's quite close to an idea of electrical power, with generators sending power through ducts/cables to devices. Here you can see some of the options, including a nuclear reactor (not as scary as it sounds).

quests.name: Power Starts With Redstone
quests.description: Redstone is a material mined in the original Minecraft. There, it's used like a signal for basic logic. If you heard somebody simulate a processor in Minecraft, it was with redstone. In Minecraft mods, redstone is very often used for power generation. The technical mods tend to use a power system to operate their machines. Most have settled on a power system known as "redstone flux" or RF. So let's start generating RF!

tasks.longDescription: Redstone is fairly common once you dig deep enough. In the Nether, it's actually more at and above the center height of Y=64. So if you go to the Nether, dig up, not down.

quests.name: The Survivalist's Generator
quests.description: This little generator is extremely fuel-efficient, but outputs power SLOOOWLY. You could fix that by... making a ton of them. However, if you make a giant tower out of them, I might find you, and mock it. You have been warned. This is still a great way to get started.

tasks.longDescription: Okay, you make one, I'll give you one. I recommend feeding it wood planks.

quests.name: Your Basic Power Cable
quests.description: There are various connectors, but we will focus on the ones in Thermal Dynamics, a bulwark for power delivery pipes. The basic power cable there is the leadstone fluxduct. It's fairly simple to make. However, it cannot transmit too much power. You can attach it to multiple sides and create alternate routes to get around this . . . for a while.

quests.name: Graphite . . . For Nukes!
quests.description: So you have a problem. You decide, "I will build a nuclear reactor." Now you have . . . lots of problems. This reactor can't explode on you, contaminate the world, and kill you constantly. It just requires a lot of stuff to make. It will take over a hundred graphite, made from 1 charcoal/coal each, and over a hundred yellorium ingots. For your trouble, you will build a 5x5x5 structure that will provide WAAAAY more power than you need for the moon trip. You can reduce the burn rate, or just build crazier stuff to use up all the RF.

tasks.longDescription: Burn wood into charcoal, and then charcoal into graphite. Repeat lots of times. You can use coal too, but that's a nice thing to keep around for making steel.

quests.name: Lava Power
quests.description: This generator runs on lava. No joke. Right click it with a bucket of lava and it will take it into its tank and start to hum on it. It's possible to get your rocket put together with just this power alone.

quests.name: Big People Solar
quests.description: If you get 4 of the basic solar generators, you can combine them into the advanced generator. It will generate 1.5x the power of the original 4 cells.

quests.name: Burning Food For Science
quests.description: The culinary generator . . . burns food to produce RF. It's not that bad really if you have an automatic farm set up. It's just kind of silly.

quests.name: I'm Your Biggest Fan
quests.description: This is a turnkey, sustainable, fire-and-forget power generator. So long as the turbine can see the sky overhead and has plenty of room around it. It also generates more power the higher up in the world it is. If you built on top of a mountain, this should work pretty well for you.

quests.name: A Hardcore Fluxduct
quests.description: The hardened fluxduct can transmit 4x the RF power of a leadstone fluxduct. You make it by augmenting existing leadstone fluxduct with invar. Invar is a 2:1 alloy of iron:nickel. You may find nickel in the world as ferrous ore. It's pretty rare. These ducts are more than you need to get to the moon . . . unless you make that nuclear reactor and maybe that digital miner.

quests.name: Weak Solar Power
quests.description: Solar power is sustainable, turnkey, and fire-and-forget . . . except that it stops at night. You will need an energy cell to store power for the night. You will also need some Mekanism equipment to make these. However, if you make that gear, you're part of the way to the Digital Miner in the Post-Scarcity section. Think about it.

tasks.longDescription: One of these will provide 40RF/tick, which is better than the survivalist generator, but only during the day! Given a 24-hour cycle, the solar generator is only marginally better, but at least you don't have to constantly feed it wood.

quests.name: Baby's First Battery
quests.description: The leadstone energy cell is a starter battery. All the power generators maintain a power reserve, but that might not be enough. This is especially an issue if you are using solar power. You need to buffer it overnight! Even if you don't, an energy cell can discharge much more quickly than some generators, and are good for jobs on the pinch. The fact that they're portable is quite useful too. USE A CRESCENT HAMMER TO MOVE THEM!

quests.name: Yellowcake, yellowcake . . .
quests.description: Remember the 64 ingots I gave you for the graphite? That won't be enough! You will need more just to build the reactor. It will need fuel. So I will be asking for 64 yellorium ingots.

tasks.longDescription: Do not use your furnace or smeltery for this! The yield is terrible! Consider pulverizing or crushing the ore first then running it through a furnace.

quests.name: The Power Of The Atom
quests.description: Let's start putting all this together. You will need reactor blocks first. You will then use some of them to make a controller, an access port, a power tap, and a control rod. You will then need 3 fuel rods. Build a 5x5 floor out of the reactor blocks. Place the 3 fuel rods as a tower in the center. Encase it on all sides, except for placing the port, tap, and controller somewhere accessible from the outside--but not the corners. Fill the top with buckets of water, and then close it off with the remaining cases. Put yellorium in the access port, and try to activate the reactor from the controller. It will tell you if it doesn't like something, and exactly where the thing it doesn't like is or isn't. Good luck!

tasks.longDescription: If I did the math right, this should be all the blocks you need for a 5x5x5 reactor, including what is consumed in making the controller, access port, and power tap.
